explanation: Agent A is correct. MISRA C 2023 Rule 17.8 states that a function parameter shall not be modified; although the objects referred to by pointer parameters may be modified, non-pointer (by-value) parameters must not be assigned to. In add_user_headers the boolean parameters add_close and add_keep_alive (passed by value) are assigned to multiple times (e.g. "add_close = false;" and "add_keep_alive = false;") which violates Rule 17.8. Note that this is distinct from modifying the object pointed to by a pointer parameter (e.g. *ppos), which is permitted. To comply, introduce local variables (e.g. bool local_add_close = add_close;) and modify those, or change the API to make the intention explicit (pass by pointer and document as in/out).
